errorMessages.account-lastname-required:

We need your full account name.
To be able to recieve donations, you need to complete the following steps below.
onboardingBankAccountHolderInfoComponent:
Within a few steps, you will be able to receive donations made through Givt. For this, we make use of Direct Debit.

In the next screen, you will be asked some details of the person who is authorised to sign the Direct Debit on this bank account.

If your account needs multiple signatories, you should invite only one, because the electronic Direct Debit system in the UK does not allow for multiple signatories. Your bank will verify the signatories only when you file a complaint.

Why does Givt work with Direct Debit?

The donations are already collected through a Direct Debit, so we have chosen to use the same system for the payments. It is important to know the following:
  • The mandate is part of the bank account verification.
  • The one-time start-up costs are collected through this system.
  • It allows us to settle the balance, in the unlikely case of a negative balance and no response is given to our request to settle this.
We will send the e-mail with an invitation to sign the DD to this person in order for the bank account to be verified.
onboardingBankAccountHolderCompletedComp: The e-mail is on its way!
As soon as the Direct Debit Instruction is signed, the account can receive payments.
onboardingBankAccountIntroComponent.what: Fill in the bank account details as on a bank statement
Verify the bank account or invite the person who will verify the bank account.
Finally, this person will check the organisation details and the bank account details and the bank account will be verified. We will send a confirmation e-mail to you as soon as this is done.
onboardingBankAccountSigningIntroCompone: As the representative of this organisation, you will be completing the agreement on engaging with Givt and the verification process for this bank account. Please review the details in the following screens thoroughly.
onboardingBankAccountSigningVerifyDetail: Is the name of the organisation correct?
onboardingBankAccountSigningDirectDebitG:
- The Guarantee is offered by all banks and building societies that accept instructions to pay Direct Debits.

- If there are any changes to the way this incidental Direct Debit Instruction is used, the organisation will notify you (normally 10 working days) in advance of your account being debited or as otherwise agreed.

- If an error is made in the payment of your Direct Debit, by the organisation, or your bank or building society, you are entitled to a full and immediate refund of the amount paid from your bank or building society.

- If you receive a refund you are not entitled to, you must pay it back when the organisation asks you to.

- You can cancel a Direct Debit at any time by simply contacting your bank or building society. Written confirmation may be required. Please also notify the organisation.
onboardingBankAccountSigningDetailsIncor: You have indicated that there were some incorrect details. An e-mail has been sent to notify the organisation admin.
onboardingBankAccountSigningCompleteComp: Now that these details are verified, a direct debit instruction will be set up for the account. Once this is set up, we can debit any outstanding fees and pay out the money which is donated to the organisation. We will sent you an e-mail with the signed direct debit instruction as attachment. Due to the advance notice period, you can expect the first payment only on the first Thursday after this period of six working days .
E-mail address of the authorised person
errorMessages.field-validation-errors: Whoops, something went wrong. Could you please check the following input?
onboardingBankAccountIntroComponent.ques:
You are about to provide the bank details of your organisation.This will be done in several steps.

To start, we need to know the account name (as it appears on a bank statement), the account number and the sort code.

To verify the account, you choose the person who is authorised by the organisation to sign the Direct Debit instruction on the bank account. The chosen person will then be emailed with an invitation to sign the Direct Debit, after he/she checked all the entered data.

Once the Direct Debit has been signed, we will send you a confirmation by e-mail.

Why does Givt work with Direct Debit?
The donations are already collected through a Direct Debit, so we have chosen to use the same system for the payments. It is important to know the following:
  • The mandate is part of the bank account verification.
  • The one-time start-up costs are collected through this system.
  • It allows us to settle the balance, in the unlikely case of a negative balance and no response is given to our request to settle this.

onboardingOrganisationDetailsCompleteCom: We have received and saved the necessary information.
onboardingOrganisationDetailsIntroCompon: Check and add the organisation details

In the following screens you will need to enter your organisation details. This can be done through a charity commission reference (if not using from another organisation) or by entering the details of your organisation manually.
onboardingOrganisationDetailsIncorrectCo: You marked some organisation details as incorrect.
onboardingOrganisationDetailsCharityNumb: Please enter the number with which you are registered with a Charity Regulator (f.i. CCEW):

If you've entered a CCEW number, we request some public information from the Charity Commission. If not, you can fill in the details of your organisation in the next screen. If you enter a reference number which is already known to us, you will be considered a child organisation of that charity. They will have to verify your information.
errorMessages.charity-number-required: Please fill in the Charity Commission reference you use
errorMessages.charity-number-not-found: Couldn't find a charity with that number. Please check again.
onboardingOrganisationDetailsIntroCompon: Click here if you don't have an English/Wales Charity Commission reference,
onboardingBankAccountSigningIntroCompone:
Verification happens in 3 parts.

In the first part, we ask you to manually verify the provided bank account details. It is important that this step will be taken with utmost care.

In the second part, we ask you to agree on the terms and the pricing of your engagement with Givt. We present you this letter of agreement in the form of a PDF document.

In the last part, we will automatically create a Direct Debit, so the payments can be enabled. The usage of this Direct Debit system has multiple advantages. To enable the payments, Givt uses the Direct Debit system.

Why does Givt work with Direct Debit?

The donations are already collected through a Direct Debit, so we have chosen to use the same system for the payments. It is important to know the following:
  • The mandate is part of the bank account verification.
  • The one-time start-up costs are collected through this system.
  • It allows us to settle the balance, in the unlikely case of a negative balance and no response is given to our request to settle this.
The letter of agreement agrees to this.

onboardingGiftAidIntroComponent.descript: Is your organisation able to receive Gift Aid? Go ahead and choose yes here below, provide the necessary details and we will ensure that everything is arranged.
onboardingGiftAidAuthorisedOfficialAddre:
An authorised official is the person within your organisation who is authorised to deal with HMRC about
your organisation's tax affairs and, where necessary, submit tax returns. This is the only person within your
organisation who is authorised to submit Gift Aid repayment claims. If you do not have an authorised official
please contact HMRC on 0300 123 1073

preboardingOrganisationRelationComponent: If your organisation is part of an organisation which is already registered with Givt, please tell us now. We might be able to use details provided by them, saving you work.
Why does Givt work with Direct Debit?

The donations are already collected through a Direct Debit, so we have chosen to use the same system for the payments. It is important to know the following:
  • The mandate is part of the bank account verification.
  • The one-time start-up costs are collected through this system.
  • It allows us to settle the balance, in the unlikely case of a negative balance and no response is given to our request to settle this.
onboardingBankAccountSigningIntroDirectD:
Why does Givt work with Direct Debit?

The donations are already collected through a Direct Debit, so we have chosen to use the same system for the payments. It is important to know the following:
  • The mandate is part of the bank account verification.
  • The one-time start-up costs are collected through this system.
  • It allows us to settle the balance, in the unlikely case of a negative balance and no response is given to our request to settle this.

Next, after agreeing with the Direct Debit Guarantee, a Direct Debit will be automatically created, so the payments can be enabled. The usage of this Direct Debit system has multiple advantages (See more at the info-button).
To enable the payments, Givt uses the Direct Debit system.
preboardingOrganisationRelationship.moda:
The Organisation (providing) wants you to use some of their details.
Some of the details are mandatory, some are optional. Please choose:
onboardingBankAccountSigningIntroCompone:
Verification happens in 3 parts.

In this first part, you will be asked to manually verify the provided bank account details. It is important that this step will be taken with utmost care.

In the second part, we ask you to agree on the terms and the pricing of your engagement with Givt. We present you this letter of agreement in the form of a PDF document.

In the last part, a SEPA mandate will be automatically generated for you, so the payments can be enabled. The usage of the SEPA Direct Debit system has multiple advantages. To enable the payments, Givt uses the SEPA system.

Why does Givt work with SEPA?

The donations are already collected through a SEPA mandate, so we have chosen to use the same system for the payments. It is important to know the following:
  • The mandate is part of the bank account verification.
  • The one-time start-up costs are collected through this system.
  • It allows us to settle the balance, in the unlikely case of a negative balance and no response is given to our request to settle this.
The letter of agreement agrees to this.
onboardingBankAccountSigningIntroDirectD:
Next, after agreeing with the SEPA mandate, a mandate will be automatically created, so the payments can be enabled. The usage of this SEPA system has multiple advantages (See more at the info-button).

To enable the payments, Givt uses the SEPA direct debit system.
onboardingBankAccountSigningDirectDebitG:
By signing this mandate, you authorise (A) GIVT Inc. to send instructions to your bank to debit your account and (B) your bank to debit your account in accordance with the instructions from GIVT Inc.

As part of your rights, you are entitled to a refund from your bank under the terms and conditions of your agreement with your bank. A refund must be claimed within 8 weeks starting from the date on which your account was debited. Your rights regarding the mandate are explained in a statement that you can obtain from your bank.
onboardingBankAccountSigningIntroDirectD:
Why is the signing of this digital mandate important?
  • Our payment provider SlimPay does a check whether the given account number is truly connected to the organisation;
  • Givt also checks the correctness of the account by debiting the startup-fee.
  • When an invoice can not be debited, Givt has the right to debit whenever the balance is sufficient again. When signing the letter of agreement, there was given permission for this.
onboardingBankAccountSigningDirectDebitG: I have read the above and I agree
onboardingBankAccountSigningCompleteComp: Now that these details are verified, a SEPA mandate will be set up for the account. Once this is set up, we can debit any outstanding fees and pay out the money which is donated to the organisation. We will sent you an e-mail with the signed SEPA mandate as attachment.
contactRegistrationIntroComponent.title: Tell us who's who
contactRegistrationIntroComponent.introT: In the following two screens you will be able to tell us which role someone is taking up in your church or organisation and what their name and email address is. The more you tell us about who's taking up which role, the better we can help you in making Givt work for you.
contactRegistrationRoleComponent.title: What role does this person have?
contactRegistrationDoneComponent.title: Success!
contactRegistrationDoneComponent.text: We've successfully registered the contact person.
onboardingBankAccountSigningAgreementCom: When you click the following button, a window will open with the terms and pricing of the agreement on engaging with Givt. Please read and download them.
I have read and agree to the terms
contactRegistrationRoleComponent.firstOp: These are the people who will take care of Givt on your location or event. We will contact these people if we f.i. have questions about beacons or your location.
contactRegistrationRoleComponent.secondO: These are the people who take care of the financials in your organisation. If something changes on the Givt dashboard, these people will want to know. The person you add for this role will automatically receive an invite to login on the Givt dashboard.
contactRegistrationRoleComponent.thirdOp: These are the people who are responsible for the communication with your visitors or your target audience. Think f.i. website, newsletter or organising events. These people will easily get started with our tips & tricks for organising giving moments or fundraising.
onboardingOrganisationDetailsAnbiCompone: Does your organisation have the ANBI status?
Please fill in the RSIN number.
bankStatementUploadComponent.title: Upload bank statement
bankStatementUploadComponent.helpText: Through this page you can send a bank statement to Givt. We will compare the bank account information as entered through the dashboard with this bank statement. This verification is necessary to make sure your organisation is owner of the bank account. After we have verified the bank statement, it will be possible to invite the bank account holder to verify the account and accept a direct debit on the account.
bankStatementUploadCompleteComponent.bod: The file has been sent to Givt successfully! Once we have verified the details on the statement, you will be able to invite the account holder to sign the mandate on the bank account.
dashboardSelectOrganisationComponent.des: You have access to the dashboards of multiple organisations. Below you can select the organisation for which you'd like to open the dashboard.
By filling out the form on the next page, you can invite someone to the dashboard. You will be asked for the first name, last name and email address of the person you want to invite.
dashboardUserRegistrationDoneComponent.t: We've successfully sent and invitation to the dashboard user.
dashboardUsersComponent.title: Dashboard users
dashboardUsersComponent.name: Name
errorMessages.past-date: The date must be in the future.
preboardingLaunchDateComponent.descripti: When do you want to launch with Givt?
